article.headline: Sacred Heart 91, Harvard 69
article.story: FAIRFIELD, Conn. (AP) -- Maurice Bailey scored 22 points Wednesday night to lead Sacred Heart to a 91-69 victory over Harvard and its first winning record since the team upgraded to Division I in 1999. Sacred Heart (7-6) have won three-straight games for the first time since 1998. The Pioneers took control of the game with a 12-4 run at the end of the first half, capped by a 3-pointer by Jarrid Frye, who finished with 16 points. Sacred Heart, which had just one victory of more than six points entering the game, turned it into a rout in the second half. The Pioneers scored seven straight to take a 59-41 lead. The Crimson got to within 14 points with eight minutes to play, but Sacred Heart responded with an 11-0 run that began with a Joey Henley dunk and ended with a Kibwe Trim slam. Omar Wellington had 14 points and seven assists, while Henley and Trim added 10 points apiece for Sacred Heart. Kevin Rogus led Harvard (2-13) with 18 points. Jason Norman (15 points), Michael Beal (14) and Matt Stehle (11) also scored in double figures for the Crimson.
